Function Documentation

void nitf_Utils_baseName ( char *  base,
const char *  fullName,
const char *  extension 
)

Return the base name for the fullName, up until the extension is encountered. Both base and fullName should have at least NITF_MAX_PATH number of elements.

Parameters:
base A user supplied base name target
fullName The source string
extension The extension name

char nitf_Utils_cornersTypeAsCoordRep ( nitf_CornersType  type  ) 

Convert the corners type to a string. If for some reason, the type is not known, return it as ' ', which is the only other valid NITF value.

void nitf_Utils_decimalToGeographic ( double  decimal,
int *  degrees,
int *  minutes,
double *  seconds 
)

Convert a double representing decimal degrees into 3 integers, one for degrees, one for minutes, and one for seconds.

The function returns these values through the passed in parameters. parameters may not be NULL

Parameters:
decimal An existing decimal degree
degrees [output] The degrees as an integer
minutes [output] The minutes as an integer
seconds [output] The seconds as an integer

double nitf_Utils_geographicToDecimal ( int  degrees,
int  minutes,
double  seconds 
)

Convert the geographic coordinates (i.e., DMS) into decimal degrees as a double.

Parameters:
degrees geographic degrees
minutes geographic minutes
seconds geographic seconds

NITF_BOOL nitf_Utils_isBlank ( char *  str  ) 

Returns 1 if the input string is either null, empty (strlen == 0), or if every character is a whitespace char.

NITF_BOOL nitf_Utils_isNumeric ( char *  str  ) 

NITF_BOOL nitf_Utils_parseDecimalString ( char *  d,
double *  decimal,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

Take in a decimal degree format string and convert it into a double. The string will be of the format +-ddd.dd or +-dd.dd.

Todo:
This function can be expanded to handle arbitrary size conversions. It is TBD whether this is desirable, since the IGEOLO itself is very strict about what is allowed

NITF_BOOL nitf_Utils_parseGeographicString ( char *  dms,
int *  degrees,
int *  minutes,
double *  seconds,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

Take in a degree of DMS format and convert it into integers The string will be of the format dddmmss[NSEW] or ddmmss[NSEW] Blank values are accepted (per NITF 2500C) and converted to 0s.

Any other string will produce an error object with code NITF_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER.

Parameters:
dms The string
degrees [output] The degrees as an integer
minutes [output] The minutes as an integer
seconds [output] The seconds as an integer

nitf_List* nitf_Utils_splitString ( char *  str,
unsigned int  max,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

Splits a string apart, delimited by spaces. This does not use strtok since it is not thread safe.)

Parameters:
str null-terminated string
max the maximum # of parts to split into (0 = split all)

void nitf_Utils_trimString ( char *  str  ) 

NITFPROT ( void   ) 

Destructor for the nitf_ImageIO object.

Destructor for the nitf_BlockingInfo object.

Replace the oldValue with the newValue within this string

Turn the geographic value into a string. You must have a buffer with 7 elements to hand in to this function, otherwise you will have memory corruption.

Turn the decimal value into a string +-dd.ddd. You must have a buffer with 7 elements to hand in to this function, otherwise you will have memory corruption.

Turn the decimal value into a string +-ddd.ddd. You must have a buffer with 7 elements to hand in to this function, otherwise you will have memory corruption.
